intro: Ebnerella occidentalis, commonly known as the western ebnerella, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in chaparral and sagebrush habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
